meanings.definition: A substance that causes the contraction of body tissues, typically used to stop bleeding or reduce secretions.
meanings.sent1: The doctor applied an astringent to the wound to help it stop bleeding.
meanings.sent2: The astringent was effective in reducing the secretions from the wound.
meanings.sent3: The astringent seemed to have a magical effect on the bleeding, like a tiny superhero.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as an astringent, tightening the bond between them.
meanings.sent5: The astringent worked like a gentle hand, pulling the tissues together tightly.

meanings.definition: Harsh or severe in manner or style.
meanings.sent1: His astringent criticism left no room for misunderstanding.
meanings.sent2: She had an astringent way of speaking that some found off-putting.
meanings.sent3: Despite his astringent tone, his words held a hint of kindness.
meanings.sent4: The astringent feedback cut through the confusion like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: Her astringent manner made it clear she meant business.

meanings.definition: Having a sharp or bitter taste.
meanings.sent1: The medicine had an astringent flavor that made it hard to swallow.
meanings.sent2: The astringent taste of the lemonade made her pucker her lips.
meanings.sent3: The astringent coffee left a bitter aftertaste in his mouth.
meanings.sent4: The astringent herbs added a sharp kick to the dish.
meanings.sent5: The astringent grapefruit juice made her eyes water.
